title.narrative: Project in Support of Restructuring of Health Sector

description.narrative: The objectives of the Health Transition Project for Turkey were to: (i) help expand the capacity of the Ministry of Health (MOH) and the Social Security Institute (SSI) to formulate and effectively implement health policies, health sector regulatory mechanisms and health insurance functions; and (ii) support the implementation of critical health services delivery reforms (Family medicine and hospital autonomy) with the objective of improving access, efficiency, quality and fiscal sustainability of the health sector. This level one restructuring paper responds to the request of the Republic of Turkey (the Borrower) and seeks the approval of the Board to make the following changes to the project in support of Restructuring of Health Sector (the Project) (P102172; loan no. 7717-TU): (i) revision of the Project Development Objective (PDO); (ii) revision of the Results Framework; (iii) cancellation of component B - piloting output-based financing for preventive health services; (iv) partial cancellation of component C - capacity building of the social security institution; (v) reallocation of the funds from component B to component A and partial cancellation of the funds of component C; and (vi) reallocation of funds between disbursement categories.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, section I, para B 2 | Description :The Borrower, through MOH, shall cause a respective Governorshipto enter into contractual arrangements with the eligible members of Participating Family Medicine Practices | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, section I, para B 4 | Description :The Borrower, through MOH Provincial Health Directorates, shallmake Capitation Payments available to each eligible member of Participating Family Medicine Practice | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, section I, para B 5 | Description :The MOH shall maintain a team of auditors for carrying outcontinuous operational review of OBF with quarterly reports | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, section II para 1 | Description :The Borrower, through MOH, shall submit to the Bank for its reviewand approval a draft of the Annual Implementation Plan and a Procurement Plan for the upcoming calendar year. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, section II para 2 | Description :The Borrower, through MOH, shall prepare Project Reports on thebasis of the indicators agreed with the Bank. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: 3. Percentage of cases in pilot provinces diagnosed and under follow-up by family group practices for the following NCDs: hypertension, diabetes, obesity/overweight
Share of public hospitals organized in public hospital unions with performance contracts for managers and global budgets
Number of international conferences to share Turkey's health reform experience
1. Per-capita annual visits to family medicine physicians
Number of provinces implementing family medicine scheme
2. Share of family medicine visits in total visits
3. Adoption of National Action Plans for (i) Health Promotion, (ii) Healthy Aging, (iii) Diabetes, (iv) Obesity, (v) CardiovascularDiseases (CVD), (vi) Chronic Respiratory Diseases (CRD)
Development of the Clinical Guideline Preparation Manual

baseline.value: No Clinical Guideline Preparation Manual exists

title.narrative: Establishment of the Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency of Turkey

baseline.value: No Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency of Turkey in existence

target.value: Agency Established and responsible for licensing and regulation of drugs and medical devices

actual.value: Agency Established and responsible for licensing and regulation of drugs and medical devices

title.narrative: Establishment of Public Health Institution responsible for health promotion, disease prevention and family medicine

baseline.value: Public Health Institution not in existence

title.narrative: 2. MOH Annual performance program prepared and submitted to the National Assembly

actual.value: Annual performance programs for 2014 and 2015 were submitted to the National assembly.

title.narrative: Component B: 1. Percentage of population of pilot provinces screened for NCD risk factors
2. Higher increase in appropriate knowledge and attitudes regarding global risk factors for NCDs in pilot provinces as compared with non-pilot provinces
4. 100 percent compliance with reporting on implementation of screening activities as well as patient records (through family medicine information system)
6. High blood pressure in population in pilot provinces decreases more as compared to non-pilot provinces
Component C: 1. Actuarial analysis of UHI updated for 2010 and 2012 based on updated macro and micro data

target.value: 3rd actuarial analysis of UHI done by WB and SSI

title.narrative: 5. Smoking prevalence among 18-29 age group in pilot provinces relative to non-pilot provinces.
2. Costly interventions under Benefits Package for UHI revised using cost-effectiveness criteria and guidelines developed by SSI;

baseline.value: Review of Benefits Package and identification of interventions and baseline expenditures

target.value: Decrease in spending on the interventions as compared to baseline

title.narrative: 3. Prospective payment systems based on international evidence (capitation, global budgets, DRGs) or outpatient and acute care adopted for University, private and MOH hospitals

baseline.value: Stock-taking and development of action plan for implementation of prospective payment systems

title.narrative: 4. Ministry of Health reorganized and focus exclusively on the health sector stewardship function

baseline.value: MOH is a provider of health services

target.value: MOH is restructured and no longer a provider of health services

actual.value: Target met. MOH is restructured and no longer a provider of health services.
